tldr: Q1 FY2025 revenue rose 6% to $22.2B with AI server momentum and a return to commercial PC growth, but margins compressed on AI mix and pricing. Management guided FY2025 revenue of $93.5B-$97.5B and EPS of $7.65 +/- $0.25, expecting ISG growth above 20% and CSG low-single-digit growth.
bullets: Revenue grew 6% to $22.2B and diluted EPS was $1.27; ISG revenue rose 22% while CSG was flat.
AI server orders were $2.6B with $1.7B of shipments; AI pipeline remained multiple of backlog.
themes: Pricing and cost pressure shaping margins

segments.title: Infrastructure Solutions Group (ISG)
points: Revenue grew 22% to $9.2B; server and networking revenue rose 42% to a record $5.5B.
Storage revenue was flat at $3.8B with strength in HCI, PowerMax, PowerStore, and PowerScale.
Operating income was $736M (8% margin), down slightly with seasonally lower storage profitability.

segments.title: Client Solutions Group (CSG)
points: Revenue was flat at $12.0B; commercial revenue grew 3% to $10.2B while consumer declined 15%.
Operating income was $732M (6.1% margin) as pricing remained competitive.

segments.title: AI servers and pipeline
points: AI server orders were $2.6B with $1.7B shipments; pipeline expanded again and remained a multiple of backlog.
Management highlighted AI attach opportunities in storage, networking, and services.

notes.title: Capital return
points: Repurchased 6.7M shares at $108.38 and paid a $0.45 dividend.
Returned $8B since FY2023 inception, or 103% of adjusted free cash flow.

notes.title: Margin drivers
points: AI server mix and competitive pricing pressured gross margin rates.
ISG margins expected to improve with storage seasonality and mix.

themes.title: AI backlog and lead times
points: Lead times vary by GPU platform and customer allocation, with H100 availability improving and H200/B200 ramping.
Backlog remains NVIDIA-heavy and pipeline continues to grow.

themes.title: AI margin profile
points: AI servers are margin-rate dilutive but margin-dollar accretive.
Storage seasonality and large-enterprise server mix also pressured margins.

top_questions.question: How should investors think about AI server lead times and backlog conversion?
top_questions.summary: Lead times depend on GPU platform allocation; backlog builds as Dell secures parts and customer delivery slots.

top_questions.question: Are AI servers driving lower ISG margins?
top_questions.summary: Mix and large-bid server profiles pressured Q1 margins; management expects ISG margins to improve through the year.

top_questions.question: What signals point to a PC refresh?
top_questions.summary: Management cited an aging installed base, Windows 10 end-of-life, and AI PC capabilities as key catalysts.

implications: AI server mix pressure may persist until storage and services attach ramps.
Enterprise AI pipeline growth supports multi-quarter ISG upside.
competitive_notes: Pricing remains competitive in PCs and large enterprise server bids.
forecast_hooks: Track AI backlog conversion as H200 and B200 availability ramps.
Watch storage revenue return to growth in the second half.
Monitor PC refresh indicators through commercial pipeline activity.

action_items: Validate AI server attach rates with storage and services partners.
Check commercial PC pipeline trends against Windows 10 refresh timing.
open_questions: How quickly will AI pricing actions offset input cost inflation?
When will storage growth turn positive and lift ISG margins?
watch_next_quarter: Q2 ISG margin progression and storage mix improvement.
AI server shipments versus the $1.7B Q1 baseline.
